title: Ghost of Okiku
marks:
Signature, Inscription and Mark

ULC: [????????? ULC: [ ???????] {?ju Tsukioka Yoshitoshi kaku}
text: Yoshitoshi was one of the last masters of ukiyoe in the Meiji period. A pupil of Utagawa Kuniyoshi (1797'1861), he also studied with Kikuchi Y'sai (1788'1878), a master of historical painting. Yoshitoshi merged the ukiyoe style with Western realism to produce a new form of print for the modern audience. His historical and heroic prints were often bizarre and ghoulish. Here, only the eyes of the ghost shine ominously in pale blue.
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
